definition: too frightened to move or speak
surname Du
birchleaf pear (tree)/to stop/to prevent/to restrict
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to bind/to wrap/a bundle/a parcel
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample
to live in luxury/lit. to ride a solid carriage pulled by fat horses
rooted to the spot (idiom); too terrified to move

the morning dew will swiftly dissipate (idiom); fig. ephemeral and precarious nature of human existence
to defect/to be disloyal

to beg while playing the xiao 箫 (mouth organ)/cf Wu Zixu 伍子胥, destitute refugee from Chu 楚, busked in Wu town c. 520 BC, then became a powerful politician
to think nothing of doing sth (idiom)/to do sth without considering the risks/to leave out of consideration
to praise sb in his presence
trembling/to shiver with fear
knife, saw, ax and hatchet (idiom); facing torture and execution
war on all sides (idiom); fighting from all four quarters
lit. to have only nine meals in thirty days (idiom)/fig. (of a family) on the brink of starvation/in dire straits
remote region
has eyes but can't see (idiom); unable or unwilling to see the importance of sth/blind (to sth great)
lit. a chicken and a bottle of wine (idiom); fig. ready to make an offering to the deceased, or to entertain guests
